intro: Sipanea ayangannensis, commonly known as the Ayangannensis Sipanea, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, temperate climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine layer of white hairs, which help reduce water loss. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Sipanea ayangannensis is considered a vulnerable species.
